column4: my experience is also that KDE feels a lot more responsive than gnome
guys, quick question: if you want to dual boot XP and ubuntu, is there any reason not to install grub in the MBR?
a friend is worried XP will break somehow if grub is installed in the MBR. works fine for me, so is there any basis for his fear?
: if it failes use the install cd and press r (repair) and type fixmbr
